summary: "Do not go gentle into that good night" is a famous poem by Welsh poet Dylan Thomas. Written in 1947, it's a villanelle, a type of poem with repeating lines. The poem encourages people to fight and resist death, and it's believed to be about Thomas's father, who passed away in 1952. The poem was first published in 1951 and became very popular. It's now considered one of Thomas's most important works.
title: Do not go gentle into that good night
